questions.question: Janet is a ................................. girl.
questions.description: Here the adjective beautiful modifies the noun girl.

questions.question: The children sang .....................................
questions.description: Here the adverb beautifully modifies the verb sang.

questions.question: The radio is too ................................. Please turn down its volume.
questions.description: Adjectives can be the complement of a verb of incomplete predication (is/am/are/was/were). Adverbs cannot be used like this.

questions.question: Why are you speaking so ................................?
questions.description: We use the adverb loudly to modify the verb speaking.

questions.question: He is a .................................... learner.
questions.description: Fast can be an adjective and an adverb. There is no such word as fastly.

questions.question: I know him .................................. well.
questions.description: Quite is the adverb. There is no such word as quitely.

questions.question: Proofread your work ...................................... before submitting it.
questions.description: Here the adverb carefully modifies the verb proofread.

questions.question: You have done an ....................................... job.
questions.description: Here we use the adjective excellent to modify the noun job.

questions.question: I thought I would pass the test ..................................., but I failed after all.
questions.description: Here we need the adverb easily to modify the verb pass.

questions.question: I have ...................................... had any rest since morning.
I have been having a lot of headaches of .............................
questions.description: Of late is similar to lately.

questions.question: He was very .................................... of the plan.
questions.description: Adjectives can be the complement of a verb of incomplete predication (is/am/are/was/were). Adverbs cannot be used like this.
